content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-024-05-A |Item_parent=Main complications of pregnancy. |Item_parent_short=Main complications of pregnancy. |Rank=A |Title=Know the definition of post partum haemorrhage (PPH) |Description=None |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors= |Order=5}} This is a '''haemorrhage >500 mL'' in the 24 hours following childbirth, whether natural or by caesarean section. This haemorrhage is '''severe''' above '''1000mL'''.'''(Cf. [[Abnormal genital bleeding in post-parfum SD-110|110. Abnormal genital bleeding in the post partum]])'''

question.title: What is the definition of postpartum hemorrhage (PPH)?
question.description: A multiple-choice question about the definition of PPH

option_a.title: A haemorrhage of >1000 mL in the 24 hours following childbirth
option_a.description: Option A describes a haemorrhage above the threshold, but not necessarily severe

option_b.title: A haemorrhage of >500 mL in the 24 hours following childbirth, whether natural or by caesarean section
option_b.description: Option B is the correct definition of PPH

option_c.title: A haemorrhage of >2000 mL in the 24 hours following childbirth
option_c.description: Option C describes a haemorrhage above the threshold, but the severity is not specified

option_d.title: A haemorrhage of >1000 mL in the 24 hours following childbirth, with symptoms of shock
option_d.description: Option D includes symptoms of shock, which are not part of the definition of PPH

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the definition of PPH
